diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,32 @@
+require 'formula'
+
+class Composer < Formula
+  url 'http://getcomposer.org/download/1.0.0-alpha2/composer.phar'
+  homepage 'http://getcomposer.org'
+  version '1.0.0-alpha2'
+  md5 'b3d440b6b8a6413d9081440b49f92098'
+
+  depends_on 'php'
+
+  def install
+    libexec.install "composer.phar"
+    sh = libexec + "composer"
+    sh.write("/usr/bin/env php #{libexec + 'composer.phar'} $*")
body:
It creates a shell script (called `composer`) which runs the command `php <installation directory>/composer.phar`, along with whatever original arguments were passed to the command.
This shell script will be made executable and symlinked in the next 2 lines, and thus composer.phar can be used from anywhere just by calling `composer`.
e.g. `composer install` will execute the following `php <installation directory>/composer.phar install`

`/usr/bin/env php` is used instead of hardcoding the php binary path.

diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,29 @@
+require 'formula'
+
+class Drush < Formula
+  homepage 'https://github.com/drush-ops/drush'
+  url 'https://github.com/drush-ops/drush/archive/6.3.0.tar.gz'
+  sha1 '90fde5acfbd6feefad02453ee9f31a0ac6d2f80e'
+
+  head do
+    url 'https://github.com/drush-ops/drush.git'
+
+    depends_on "Homebrew/php/composer" => :build
+  end
+
+  def install
+    system 'composer', 'install' if build.head?
+
+    prefix.install_metafiles
+    libexec.install Dir['*'] - ['drush.bat']
+    (bin+'drush').write <<-EOS.undent
+      #!/bin/sh
+
+      export ETC_PREFIX=${ETC_PREFIX:=#{HOMEBREW_PREFIX}}
+      export SHARE_PREFIX=${SHARE_PREFIX:=#{HOMEBREW_PREFIX}}
body:
Drush will look for a config file in `$ETC_PREFIX/drush/drushrc.php`.

To make the file persistent over upgrades it needs to be in (with `HOMEBREW_PREFIX`being `/usr/local`) `/usr/local/etc/drush/drushrc.php`.

If I used `prefix`it would end up being `/usr/local/opt/drush/etc/drush/drushrc.php` and that file would be nuked when the formula is upgrade.

It's the same story with `$SHARE_PREFIX`. Drush will look in `$SHARE_PREFIX/share/doc/drush/commands` for commands installed by other formulas (`drupal-code-sniffer.rb` does that).

They would also be nuked if installed inside `prefix`.

So, the reason for using `HOMEBREW_PREFIX` is to point outside `prefix` for stuff that should survive an upgrade.

body:
Not that I've seen. I've only gotten bits a pieces of it but as far as I've understood it the following applies

Never touch the bottle block, the bot does that for us
Revision always goes outside the bottle block when its manually added
As far as I know the revision statement can only exist once either in or outside the bottle code.
It should all originate from the Formula module https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/blob/master/Library/Homebrew/formula.rb

body: Ah! I found it: [class-level revision](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/blob/b8ce1fe1b2abfc6b38a6c6451ef8074f2a83a8eb/Library/Homebrew/formula.rb#L112): > ``` > # Used for creating new Homebrew versions of software without new upstream > # versions. > # @see .revision > attr_reader :revision > > ``` [bottle-leverel revision](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/blob/b8ce1fe1b2abfc6b38a6c6451ef8074f2a83a8eb/Library/Homebrew/formula.rb#L1770): > ``` > bottle do > ... > revision 1 # Making the old bottle outdated without bumping the version/revision of the formula. > ... > end > ``` I will fix PR according to this info, thanks for the link!

     end
 
-    option 'with-apache', 'Enable building of shared Apache 2.4 Handler module'

+    option 'with-httpd24', 'Enable building of shared Apache 2.4 Handler module'
+    option 'with-httpd22', 'Enable building of shared Apache 2.2 Handler module'
     deprecated_option "homebrew-apxs" => "with-homebrew-apxs"
-    deprecated_option "with-homebrew-apxs" => "with-apache"
+    deprecated_option "with-homebrew-apxs" => "with-httpd24"
+    deprecated_option "with-apache" => "with-httpd24"
+    deprecated_option "with-apache22" => "with-httpd22"
+
+    depends_on "homebrew/apache/httpd24" => :optional
+    depends_on "homebrew/apache/httpd22" => :optional
body:
These two lines make the formula always depend on the `homebrew/apache` tap, even when nothing is required from it.
This change rendered installing or updating PHP impossible on Linuxbrew because `homebrew/apache` cannot be installed on Linuxbrew.

Shouldn't these two lines be like this?

    depends_on "homebrew/apache/httpd24" => :optional if build.include?('with-httpd24')
    depends_on "homebrew/apache/httpd22" => :optional if build.include?('with-httpd22')

I cannot tell anything about the situation when PHP is a dependency of other formula but the change I propose here fixes the installation and upgrade of PHP on Linuxbrew when the `with-httpd2x` options are not used.

body:
Default is `0`.
https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/blob/master/Library/Homebrew/formula.rb#L174

```
Version.new("0.11.1") > Version.new("5839c25")
=>false
```

Not sure about what you expect this to return. Is it being run from `brew irb`? `Version` itself doesn't have the support for schemes meaning schemes' resolution is not something you can see comparing two `Version` instances.

body: Remove this line

Line 23 declares the last version as default if no other is installed, which shouldn't be an alpha version (which is why php71 is not in last place). The line should read `$supported_php_versions = %w{php53 php54 php55 php56 php70 php72 php71}`, making 7.1 the default if no version has been installed yet.

 If you want PHP-FPM to listen on a Unix socket instead of a TCP socket (see the virtual host configuration below), which is faster when the web server and PHP-FPM are on the same machine, you must change `listen = 127.0.0.1:9000` to `listen = /tmp/php-fpm.sock` in php-fpm.conf.
 
+More importantly, you can change the pool configuration file `$(brew --prefix)/etc/php/7.0/php-fpm.d/www.conf` and replace the values for `user` and `group` to your user name and "staff" as group. This will avoid permission and ownership of files in your document root.
